alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 12:41PM MDT until June 23 at 1:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. For the Wind River Basin...including Crowheart, Kinnear...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Wind River near Kinnear. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Minor agricultural flooding along right bank. Water begins to move towards low areas north of Highway 132. At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Agricultural flooding along both banks becomes more widespread and intensifies. Water begins to encroach the north end of Highway 132. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to slowly fall through Thursday, but remain at or above action stage. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement.
